content: From May 1st, the government has opened several vaccination centers for people aged between 18 to 45. As the vaccines are scarce and logging in every time to check status is a cumbersome process, I have used open APIs provided by the government to keep track of the availability of vaccines in my home district of Nagpur. Warning This post is a work in progress! A more detailed post coming soon.
title: Cowin India Vaccine Appointment Availability

content: Demo -- Update: version 2 Version 1 is here: https://replit.com/@Pjha/CadetblueSelfishQuery
title: Cowin India Vaccine Appointment Availability

content: Cowin APIs in Python import requests import json # Appointment availibility (18+) url = "https://cdn-api.co-vin.in/api/v2/appointment/sessions/public/findByDistrict" params = {"district_id": "365", "date": "07-05-2021"} response = requests.get(url, params=params) print("HTTP ", response.status_code) data = response.json() for session in data["sessions"]: if session["min_age_limit"] == 45: print(json.dumps(session, indent=2)) # Appointment availibility for (18+) for 7 days url = "https://cdn-api.co-vin.in/api/v2/appointment/sessions/public/calendarByDistrict" params = {"district_id": "365", "date": "07-05-2021"} response = requests.get(url, params=params) print("HTTP ", response.status_code) data = response.json() for center in data["centers"]: for session in center["sessions"]: if session["min_age_limit"] == 18 and session["vaccine"]=="COVISHIELD" and session["available_capacity"] > 0: print(json.dumps(session, indent=2)) # API for state and district lists url = "https://cdn-api.co-vin.in/api/v2/admin/location/states" response = requests.get(url) print("HTTP ", response.status_code) print(json.dumps(response.json(), indent=2)) state_id = "21" url = "https://cdn-api.co-vin.in/api/v2/admin/location/districts/" + state_id response = requests.get(url) print("HTTP ", response.status_code) print(json.dumps(response.json(), indent=2))
title: Cowin India Vaccine Appointment Availability

content: Cowin APIs in JavaScript var request = new XMLHttpRequest() request.open('GET', 'https://cdn-api.co-vin.in/api/v2/appointment/sessions/public/findByDistrict?district_id=365&date=07-05-2021', true) request.onload = function () { var data = JSON.parse(this.response); if (request.status >= 200 && request.status < 400) { console.log("Success!"); console.log(this.response); } else { console.log("Failure!"); console.log(this.response) const errorMessage = document.createElement('marquee') errorMessage.textContent = `Gah, it's not working!` app.appendChild(errorMessage) } } request.send()
title: Cowin India Vaccine Appointment Availability

content: Fastai is a deep learning library built with Pytorch for rapidly building neural networks. For image classification problems, I start with fastai to get a feel of the problem and set some realistic expectations. This template acts as the first iteration of a solution. Customization and enhancements are done on top of this code to suit a problem statement.
title: Image Classification With Fastai

content: Code from fastai.vision import * from fastai.metrics import error_rate path = untar_data(URLs.PETS) path.ls() path_anno = path/'annotations' path_img = path/'images' fnames = get_image_files(path_img) np.random.seed(2) pat = r'/([^/]+)_\d+.jpg$' data = ImageDataBunch.from_name_re(path_img, fnames, pat, ds_tfms=get_transforms(), size=224, bs=32).normalize(imagenet_stats) data.show_batch(rows=3, figsize=(7,6)) print(data.classes) print(len(data.classes)) # training learn = cnn_learner(data, models.resnet34, metrics=error_rate) learn.model learn.fit_one_cycle(4) learn.save('stage-1') # interpreting results interp = ClassificationInterpretation.from_learner(learn) losses,idxs = interp.top_losses() len(data.valid_ds)==len(losses)==len(idxs) interp.plot_top_losses(9, figsize=(15,11)) interp.plot_confusion_matrix(figsize=(12,12), dpi=60) interp.most_confused(min_val=2) # fine tuned training learn.unfreeze() learn.fit_one_cycle(1) learn.load('stage-1') learn.lr_find() learn.recorder.plot() learn.unfreeze() learn.fit_one_cycle(2, max_lr=slice(1e-6,1e-4))
title: Image Classification With Fastai

content: References Fastai video Fastai documentation View on Colaboratory View on Github
title: Image Classification With Fastai
